column3: Suggested by @MarcoFalke here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12887#issuecomment-378731795\n\nlinter hints suggested by @laanwj here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12887#issuecomment-378842036

Very strong concept ACK. Thanks for making this fix persistent by adding a lint script.

Please apply this patch to the lint script to make it work as expected:

```diff
--- lint-logs.sh	2018-04-05 22:43:14.119412169 +0200
+++ lint-logs.sh.fixed	2018-04-05 22:42:03.787354149 +0200
@@ -13,10 +13,10 @@
 # ignored


-UNTERMINATED_LOGS=$(git grep "LogPrintf(" -- *cpp | \
-	grep
Thanks for the review and bugfixes @practicalswift ! Your fixed version caught a non-conforming log, which I've fixed in a new commit.
Since you are changing those lines anyway, why not use `LogPrintfContinuation` or something?

My suggestion here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12887#issuecomment-378936648 has inverted semantics. This `Continued` here comment indicates that there is a continuation log to follow. `LogPrintfContinuation()` would indicate that the log continues a previous log.

I think `LogPrintfContinuation()` could be useful, but it's a rebase-the-world PR since it removes the `
` from every
Yes, please don't change every single log message. This solution is fine.
Unfortunately this change is wrong, as tx->ToString() adds a final newline: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/primitives/transaction.cpp#L99
ah, well spotted. Now fixed.\n\nIncidentally, I hate this log. As far as I'm aware it's the only one with newlines embedded and it confuses my log parser!
